abstract: Sharp backlash greets decision by Gov Pat McCrory of North Carolina to sign broad law that not only eliminates protection for lesbians, gays and bisexuals against discrimination across state, but prohibits municipalities and cities from passing their own anti-discrimination measures; trigger for law was passage in Charlotte of ordinance allowing transgender people to use public restrooms corresponding with their gender identity; critics of law vow strong battle.
lead_paragraph: On social media and in public rallies, civil rights groups, businesses and politicians expressed dismay at the law, which was passed by the Republican-controlled legislature.

headline.main: North Carolina Gay Bias Law Draws a Sharp Backlash
headline.print_headline: North Carolina Law Barring Anti-Discrimination Measures Draws Sharp Backlash
